messageBody:
Eric Vought wrote:
>
> This is a very interesting response. Perhaps you would like to consider:
>
> 1) Very little, if any, blame for the perceived problem was put on the
> posters other to note the situation. In fact, the discussion quickly
> focused on how to make it easier for people to find the information they need
> and make better use of the list.
>
> 2) This has quickly launched into a concrete discussion (and beginnings of
> action) for improving the documentation available to the community.

I really like the idea of sending a FAQ as part of the initial mailing
when someone subscribes to the list. Hopefully, it will drastically
reduce the "dumb" questions (and many of the smarter ones), and allow us
to feel better about ignoring the ones that get through anyway. And if
someone asks a dumb question that isn't covered by the FAQ, a reasoned
response should go into the FAQ!

Suggestions:
1. It should include a link to the latest version of the FAQ on the web
somewhere. That way, older subscribers can keep up to date.

2. It should be posted to the list whenever it is updated, similar to
many Usenet FAQs.

3. Can we PLEASEPLEASEPLEASE include a link to the ESR essay that
someone posted earlier? It is much easier to answer questions when the
questions are phrased well, and basic rules of etiquette are followed.
Of course, those who ask the worst questions don't read documentation
anyway, but it would feel good. :}
